ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained skills specific to my research
This was the course I had for my senior thesis when working together with Nils Rudi
I made great progress on my senior thesis. Finished my methods section, did two rounds data collection, and have a draft of my introduction. Good relation with my thesis advisor and grad mentor.
I was able to explore my interest in emotional intelligence, further my knowledge, and help push projects forward.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I designed this course myself so there are no weaknesses. It was good that I could get my cognitive science research done while getting credit through the major

Strengths - a great opportunity to dive deep into an area of interest, an awesome way to learn from more advanced people in the field

Weaknesses - maybe more structure!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're doing research in cog sci, then I would highly recommend it!

Definitely take research for credit if you're a Cog Sci major, especially if you're writing a thesis that is empirical work. You need the time to conduct your analysis and your experiments in whatever lab you're working in. This ensures that you can also use this work towards your depth. I wish I had known about this earlier on during Yale, but it worked out well

Yes! Its a perfect fifth credit if youre going to be working in a lab anyways. Prof Knobe is so flexible and chill with approving your proposal, which makes spending time on research really accessible. Your experience will obviously be defined by the lab youre in, but its still great to get credit for it.
Yes! Research is a great thing to do at Yale
